data.name: Celebi VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Curative Forest
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may heal 20 damage from each of your Grass Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Plant
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Snover
data.flavorText: The berries that grow around its belly are like ice pops. Galarian Darumaka absolutely love these berries.

data.name: Deerling
data.flavorText: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Sawsbuck
data.flavorText: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck's horns.

attacks.name: Winter Horn
attacks.text: If you have a Stadium in play, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Tsareena
data.flavorText: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon's legs leaves a wound in the opponent's body and soul that will never heal.

attacks.name: Tread On
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Colorless in your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost.

data.name: Zarude
data.flavorText: Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

attacks.name: Pack Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you go second and it's your first turn, search for up to 3 Grass Pokémon instead of 1. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Repeated Whip
attacks.text: This attack does 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Blaziken VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Max Blaze
attacks.text: Choose up to 2 of your Benched Rapid Strike Pokémon and attach an Energy card from your discard pile to each of them.

data.name: Scorbunny
data.flavorText: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it's raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

data.name: Sealeo
data.flavorText: Be it Spheal or a Poké Ball, it will spin any round object on its nose with the greatest of ease.

data.name: Zeraora V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross Fist
attacks.text: If 1 of your other Rapid Strike Pokémon used an attack during your last turn, this attack also does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Galarian Slowpoke
data.flavorText: Because Galarian Slowpoke eat the seeds of a plant that grows only in Galar, their tails have developed a spicy flavor.

data.name: Galarian Articuno V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Reconstitute
abilities.text: You must discard 2 cards from your hand in order to use this Ability. Once during your turn, you may draw a card.

attacks.name: Psyray
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Gardevoir
data.flavorText: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

abilities.name: Shining Arcana
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck and attach any number of basic Energy cards you find there to your Pokémon in any way you like. Put the other cards into your hand.

attacks.name: Brainwave
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Banette
data.flavorText: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

attacks.name: Resolute Spite
attacks.text: Put up to 7 damage counters on this Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage for each damage counter you placed in this way.

attacks.name: Eerie Light
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Cresselia
data.flavorText: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Crescent Glow
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Psychic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If you go second and it's your first turn, instead search for up to 3 Psychic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Photon Laser
attacks.text: If you have at least 5 Energy in play, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Shadow Rider Calyrex VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Underworld Door
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Psychic Pokémon. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Max Geist
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Dugtrio
data.flavorText: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it's like underground.

attacks.name: Triple Heads
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads. If all of them are heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Passimian
data.flavorText: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

abilities.name: Throwing Coach
abilities.text: Your Rapid Strike Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Benched Pokémon V and Benched Pokémon-GX (before applying Weakness and Resistance). You can't apply more than 1 Throwing Coach Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Fling
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Sandaconda V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Wall of Sand
abilities.text: This Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Clobbopus
data.flavorText: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn't alarmed when that happens—it knows they'll grow back. It's about as smart as a three-year-old.

data.name: Grapploct
data.flavorText: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

abilities.name: Stranglehold Master
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is in the Active Spot, your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is ColorlessColorless more.

attacks.name: Synchro Buster
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Kubfu
data.flavorText: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

attacks.name: Training
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Galarian Slowking V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Concoction
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Word of Ruin
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

data.name: Galarian Slowking VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Max Toxify
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. During Pokémon Checkup, put 12 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1.

data.name: Seviper
data.flavorText: Constant polishing makes the edge of the blade on its tail extremely sharp. It's Zangoose's archrival.

attacks.name: Strong Tail
attacks.text: If you played a Single Strike Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Whirlipede
data.flavorText: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.

data.name: Skwovet
data.flavorText: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It'll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

attacks.name: Scrounge
attacks.text: Put a Pokémon Tool card from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Doctor
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Fire-Resistant Gloves
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Fire Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Peony
rules: Discard your hand and search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Welcoming Lantern
rules: Put a Single Strike Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Lucky Energy
rules: As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides Colorless Energy.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if it is Knocked Out), draw a card.

data.name: Shadow Rider Calyrex V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shadow Mist
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, they can't play any Special Energy or Stadium cards from their hand.

attacks.name: Astral Barrage
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon and put 5 damage counters on each of them.

data.name: Galarian Moltres V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Direflame Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Darkness Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon. You can't use more than 1 Direflame Wings Ability each turn.

attacks.name: Aura Burn
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Galarian Slowking V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Concoction
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Word of Ruin
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon will be Knocked Out.

data.name: Liepard V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Hidden Claw
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may discard a Pokémon Tool from a Pokémon (yours or your opponent's).

attacks.name: Shadow Ripper
attacks.text: You may put this Pokémon and all attached cards into your hand.

data.name: Metagross V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Synchro Hammer
attacks.text: If this Pokémon and your opponent's Active Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Tornadus V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blow Through
attacks.text: If a Stadium is in play, this attack does 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Blasting Hammer
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Agatha
rules: Move up to 3 damage counters from your Active Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Avery
rules: Draw 3 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, your opponent discards Pokémon from their Bench until they have 3.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Doctor
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Honey
rules: Draw a card for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon V.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Karen's Conviction
rules: During this turn, your Single Strike Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Melony
rules: Attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon V. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Ice Rider Calyrex VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ride of the High King
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Lance
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 Energy from this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 120 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Caitlin
rules: Put any number of cards from your hand on the bottom of your deck in any order. Then, draw that many cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Doctor
rules: Draw 2 cards. If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, draw 2 more cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Welcoming Lantern
rules: Put a Single Strike Supporter card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Weedle
data.flavorText: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

data.name: Kakuna
data.flavorText: While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 40 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Beedrill
data.flavorText: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

attacks.name: Persist Sting
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon has any Special Energy attached, it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Jet Spear
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Ledian
data.flavorText: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

attacks.name: Rapid Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Celebi V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaflet Dance
attacks.text: Attach any number of Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Slash Back
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Abomasnow
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is known to bring blizzards. A shake of its massive body is enough to cause whiteout conditions.

abilities.name: Toughness Boost
abilities.text: Your Single Strike Pokémon in play, except any Abomasnow, get +50 HP. You can't apply more than 1 Toughness Boost Ability at a time.

data.name: Steenee
data.flavorText: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Rillaboom
data.flavorText: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

attacks.name: Wood Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Raging Repeated Strike
attacks.text: Discard any amount of Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Lapras
data.flavorText: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

attacks.name: Wintry Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Melony cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Castform Rainy Form
data.flavorText: This is Castform's form when pelted by rain. In an experiment where it was placed in a shower, this Pokémon didn't change to this form.

abilities.name: Weather Reading
abilities.text: If you have 8 or more Stadium cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Rainfall
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as −150 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Froslass
data.flavorText: It spits out cold air of nearly −60 degrees Fahrenheit to freeze its quarry. It brings frozen prey back to its lair and neatly lines them up.

abilities.name: Frost Over
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crystal Breath
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Walrein
data.flavorText: It shatters drift ice with its strong tusks. Its thick layer of blubber repels enemy attacks.

attacks.name: Hail Prison
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tapu Fini
data.flavorText: Although it's called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

attacks.name: Smash Turn
attacks.text: You may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ocean Loop
attacks.text: Put an Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand.

data.name: Rapid Strike Urshifu
data.flavorText: This form of Urshifu is a strong believer in defeating foes by raining many blows down on them. Its strikes are nonstop, flowing like a river.

attacks.name: Rapid-Fisted Rush
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each of your Rapid Strike Pokémon in play.

data.name: Golurk
data.flavorText: There's a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn't been proven.

attacks.name: Reinforced Punch
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool attached, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Megaton Fall
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Swirlix
data.flavorText: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix's fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Slurpuff
data.flavorText: Slurpuff's fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

attacks.name: Follow the Scent
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. Put a number of cards up to the number of heads from your discard pile into your hand.

data.name: Hatterene
data.flavorText: If you're too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.

abilities.name: Witch Rondo
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches their Active Pokémon with 1 of their Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: This attack does 50 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Diglett
data.flavorText: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from and effects of attacks done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Galarian Zapdos V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Fighting Instinct
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless less for each of your opponent's Pokémon V in play.

attacks.name: Thunderous Kick
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Gallade
data.flavorText: Sharply attuned to others' wishes for help, this Pokémon seeks out those in need and aids them in battle.

attacks.name: Feint
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Dynablade
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon V in play.

data.name: Galarian Yamask
data.flavorText: It's said that this Pokémon was formed when an ancient clay tablet was drawn to a vengeful spirit.

attacks.name: Brutal Swing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

data.name: Crabominable
data.flavorText: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

attacks.name: Double Lariat
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

data.name: Rockruff
data.flavorText: When it rubs the rocks on its neck against you, that's proof of its love for you. However, the rocks are sharp, so the gesture is quite painful!

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lycanroc
data.flavorText: They live alone without forming packs. They will only listen to orders from Trainers who can draw out their true power.

attacks.name: Rogue Fangs
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each Single Strike Pokémon in your discard pile.

data.name: Sandaconda VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Sand Pulse
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: G-Max Cyclone
attacks.text: Move any amount of Energy from your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

data.name: Galarian Slowking
data.flavorText: While chanting strange spells, this Pokémon combines its internal toxins with what it's eaten, creating strange potions.

abilities.name: Mysterious Potion
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may choose 1 of your Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, heal 90 damage from that Pokémon. If tails, put 3 damage counters on that Pokémon.

data.name: Spiritomb
data.flavorText: It was bound to a fissure in an Odd Keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

attacks.name: Ghostly Cries
attacks.text: For each Pokémon in your opponent's discard pile, put 1 damage counter on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If you placed any damage counters in this way, your opponent shuffles all Pokémon from their discard pile into their deck.

data.name: Scolipede
data.flavorText: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Venoshock
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is Poisoned, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: When it evolves, it sheds the steel carapace that covered its whole body and develops a new one.

data.name: Cobalion
data.flavorText: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Slash
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Castform
data.flavorText: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform's disposition!

abilities.name: Weather Reading
abilities.text: If you have 8 or more Stadium cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: Weather Force
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

data.name: Kecleon
data.flavorText: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.

abilities.name: Chromashift
abilities.text: This Pokémon is the same type as any basic Energy attached to it. (If it has 2 or more different types of basic Energy attached, this Pokémon is each of those types.)

data.name: Brawly
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Rapid Strike Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Dyna Tree Hill
rules: Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) can't be healed.
This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Flannery
rules: Discard a Special Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon, and discard a Stadium in play.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Justified Gloves
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Darkness Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Karen's Conviction
rules: During this turn, your Single Strike Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each Prize card your opponent has taken (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Peonia
rules: Put up to 3 Prize cards into your hand. Then, for each Prize card you put into your hand in this way, put a card from your hand face down as a Prize card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Siebold
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Rapid Strike Pokémon and heal 60 damage from each of them.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Weeding Gloves
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Impact Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to a Single Strike Pokémon. If this card is attached to anything other than a Single Strike Pokémon, discard this card.

As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. The Pokémon this card is attached to can't be Poisoned, and if it is already Poisoned, it recovers from that Special Condition.

data.name: Spiral Energy
rules: This card can only be attached to a Rapid Strike Pokémon. If this card is attached to anything other than a Rapid Strike Pokémon, discard this card.

As long as this card is attached to a Pokémon, it provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. The Pokémon this card is attached to can't be Paralyzed, and if it is already Paralyzed, it recovers from that Special Condition.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaflet Dance
attacks.text: Attach any number of Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Slash Back
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Zeraora V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cross Fist
attacks.text: If 1 of your other Rapid Strike Pokémon used an attack during your last turn, this attack also does 160 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Shadow Rider Calyrex V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if it is Knocked Out), put an Energy attached to the Attacking Pokémon into your opponent's hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Ledyba

attacks.name: Collect

data.name: Bounsweet

data.name: Grookey

data.flavorText: It's skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Delibird
data.flavorText: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it's always scrounging around for more food.

attacks.name: Frosty Typhoon

data.name: Spheal
data.flavorText: Its body is covered in fluffy fur. The fur keeps it from feeling cold while it is rolling on ice.

data.name: Blitzle
data.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear

data.name: Thundurus
data.flavorText: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

attacks.name: Assisting Spark

attacks.name: Thunder
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Gengar
data.flavorText: It is said to emerge from darkness to steal the lives of those who become lost in mountains.

attacks.name: Pain Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 40 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Ralts

data.name: Shuppet
data.flavorText: There's a proverb that says, "Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk."

data.name: Golett
data.flavorText: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

data.name: Inkay
data.flavorText: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

data.name: Malamar
data.flavorText: It's said that Malamar's hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

data.name: Hattrem

attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

data.name: Castform Sunny Form
data.flavorText: Castform changes to this form when it basks in bright sunlight. When you touch its glowing skin, it feels all dried out!

abilities.name: Weather Reading
abilities.text: If you have 8 or more Stadium cards in your discard pile, ignore all Energy in this Pokémon's attack costs.

attacks.name: High-Pressure Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium in play. If you can't, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.

data.name: Volcanion V

attacks.name: Volley Kick
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Weavile
data.flavorText: With its claws, it leaves behind signs for its friends to find. The number of distinct signs is said to be over 500.

data.flavorText: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

attacks.name: Keep Calling
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Rapid Strike Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

data.name: Drizzile
data.flavorText: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Inteleon
data.flavorText: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes' weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

abilities.name: Quick Shooting
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may put 2 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

data.name: Ice Rider Calyrex V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glacial Lance
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mareep

attacks.name: Growl
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 20 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Flaaffy
data.flavorText: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

data.name: Ampharos
data.flavorText: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Searchlight Tail
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals their hand. If you find any Energy cards there, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Zebstrika
data.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

attacks.name: Coordinated Bolt
attacks.text: If 1 of your other Rapid Strike Pokémon used an attack during your last turn, this attack does 90 more damage.

attacks.name: Spark Rush
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage for each heads.

data.name: Gastly
data.flavorText: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

attacks.name: Sleep Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

data.name: Haunter
data.flavorText: If you get the feeling of being watched in darkness when nobody is around, Haunter is there.

data.name: Hatenna
data.flavorText: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.

data.name: Galarian Runerigus
data.flavorText: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you'll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

abilities.name: Spiteful Slate

rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

data.name: Venipede
data.flavorText: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

data.name: Porygon
data.flavorText: It was built 20 years ago by scientists who dreamed of exploring space. Their dreams have yet to come true.

data.name: Porygon2
data.flavorText: Even though it doesn't die in the vacuum of space, it can't move around very well in zero gravity.

attacks.name: Tri Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.text: You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Sky Return

rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

data.name: Greedent
data.flavorText: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.

abilities.name: Brazen Tail
abilities.text: Energy attached to your Pokémon can't be put into your hand, deck, or discard pile by an effect of your opponent's Item or Supporter cards.

data.name: Agatha
rules: Move up to 3 damage counters from your Active Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Avery
rules: Draw 3 cards. If you drew any cards in this way, your opponent discards Pokémon from their Bench until they have 3.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Crushing Gloves
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The attacks of the Pokémon this card is attached to do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Metal Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Echoing Horn
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon from your opponent's discard pile onto their Bench.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Expedition Uniform
rules: Look at the bottom 3 cards of your deck and put them on top of your deck in any order.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Fog Crystal
rules: Search your deck for a Psychic Energy card or a Basic Psychic Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Galarian Chestplate
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to has "Galarian" in its name, it takes 30 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Klara
rules:
Choose 1 or both:
• Put up to 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
• Put up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Melony
rules: Attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon V. If you do, draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Old Cemetery
rules: Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their non-Psychic Pokémon, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.
This Stadium stays in play when you play it. Discard it if another Stadium comes into play. If a Stadium with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

data.name: Path to the Peak
rules: Pokémon with a Rule Box in play (both yours and your opponent's) have no Abilities. (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes.)

data.name: Rapid Strike Scroll of the Skies
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.
The Rapid Strike Pokémon this card is attached to can use the attack on this card. (You still need the necessary Energy to use this attack.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Rugged Helmet
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

If the Pokémon this card is attached to is in the Active Spot and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon (even if it is Knocked Out), put an Energy attached to the Attacking Pokémon into your opponent's hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
